appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.increaseContrastDescription: Enable high contrast colors for improved legibility. Further accessibility improvements coming soon.
appearance.showAccountHeaderDescription: When enabled, displays an account header above notification list groups which links to the profile page of the account.
appearance.showFullTitleDescription: Wrap long notification titles onto multiple lines instead of truncating them.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.fetchAllDescription: When enabled, fetch all unread notifications from GitHub.
notifications.fetchDetailedDescription: When enabled, fetch additional notification details such as labels, milestones, and reviews.
notifications.showMetricPillsDescription: Show notification metric pills such as comments, reviews, and labels.
notifications.showGitHubNumberDescription: Show the GitHub issue or pull request number.
notifications.fetchParticipatingDescription: Only fetch notifications where you are directly participating or mentioned.
notifications.markDoneOnOpenDescription: Mark notification as done when opened in browser.
notifications.markDoneOnUnsubscribeDescription: Mark notification as done when unsubscribed.
notifications.delayStateDescription: Delay updating notification state until the next fetch cycle.

tray.title: Tray
tray.showCountDescription: Display the number of unread notifications in the tray icon.
tray.highlightUnreadDescription: Highlight the tray icon when there are unread notifications.
tray.alternateIconDescription: Use an alternate idle icon for the tray.

system.title: System
system.keyboardShortcutDescription: Enable the global keyboard shortcut to open GitChan.
system.showSystemNotificationsDescription: Show desktop notifications for new GitHub notifications.
system.playSoundDescription: Play a sound when receiving new notifications.
system.openAtStartupDescription: Launch GitChan when your computer starts.

reset.title: Reset settings?
reset.description: Please confirm that you want to reset all settings to the GitChan defaults

state.title: State
state.closedDescription: Closed, completed, duplicate, resolved or not planned
state.otherDescription: Catch all for any other notification states

reason.title: Reason
reason.approvalRequestedDescription: You were requested to review and approve a deployment.
reason.assignedDescription: You were assigned to the issue.
reason.ciActivityDescription: A GitHub Actions workflow run was triggered for your repository.
reason.invitationReceivedDescription: You accepted an invitation to contribute to the repository.
reason.manualDescription: You subscribed to the thread (via an issue or pull request).
reason.memberFeatureRequestedDescription: Organization members have requested to enable a feature such as Draft Pull Requests or Copilot.
reason.mentionedDescription: You were specifically @mentioned in the content.
reason.reviewRequestedDescription: You, or a team you're a member of, were requested to review a pull request.
reason.securityAdvisoryCreditDescription: You were credited for contributing to a security advisory.
reason.securityAlertDescription: GitHub discovered a security vulnerability in your repository.
reason.stateChangeDescription: You changed the thread state (for example, closing an issue or merging a pull request).
reason.teamMentionDescription: You were on a team that was mentioned.

badCredentials.title: Bad Credentials
badCredentials.description: Your credentials are either invalid or expired.

missingScopes.title: Missing Scopes
missingScopes.description: Your credentials are missing a required API scope.

network.title: Network Error
network.description1: Unable to connect to one or more of your GitHub environments.
network.description2: Please check your network connection, including whether you require a VPN, and try again.

rateLimited.title: Rate Limited
rateLimited.description: Please wait a while before trying again.

validation.failedToValidateToken: Failed to validate provided token against {{hostname}}
validation.failedToValidateOAuth: Failed to validate provided Client ID and Secret against {{hostname}}

single.author: Update on your thread! ‚úèÔ∏è
single.teamMention: Your team was mentioned! Let's check together~ üë•

login.title: Login
login.hostnameHint: Change only if you are using GitHub Enterprise Server
login.pasteTokenBelow: on GitHub to paste the token below.
login.useCredentialsBelow: and use your client id & secret below.
